mammals.question: Camels use their humps as nourishment when food is scarce
mammals.explanation: Some think they hold water but it's not. Their humps are fat stores, which look droopy if the animals’ bodies burn that fat when food is scarce.

fishes.question: There is a species of jellyfish that technically doesn't perish and thus immortal

fishes.question: Any sharks that stop swimming will suffocate and die
fishes.explanation: All sharks lack swim bladder, so when they stop swimming they fall into bottom of ocean floor, and their bodies are so incompressible that it doesn't harm them, they can always ascent or descent for oxygen when needed

fishes.question: Whales respond to screams and other loud noises made by humans

fishes.question: Sharks don't get cancer

reptilesAndAmphibians.question: Snakes do not have bones
reptilesAndAmphibians.explanation: All snakes are vertebrate animals, and do have bones. They have a skull and specialized jaw bones and ligaments, many connected vertebra, or a spinal backbone, and as many as 300-400 pairs of ribs or more, among a few other minor bones present.

reptilesAndAmphibians.question: Snakes do not have ears

reptilesAndAmphibians.question: Snakes unhinge their jaws to swallow their prey
